data.title: "Southern cooking makes you good looking!"
data.text: It's the BEST southern buffet I've ever eaten! The menu is different each day. The food is delicious. Be patient! It's going to be crowded, but there's a reason. It's worth waiting for. Lots of homemade desserts. And tell the owners, Steve and Imogene, I said "hello."

data.title: Delicious Home Cooking
data.text: Was meeting a friend for lunch and was craving home cooking. Chef's In was the perfect place!  Choose from a great salad bar and a delicious buffet of Southern favorites like fried chicken, meat loaf, black eyed peas and so much more! Buffet and drink is only $10.

data.title: Chef's Inn
data.text: If you are downtown the hours they are open. This is definitely a good place to eat. Good cooks there, and it's clean.

data.title: Love it!
data.text: Love this place. Especially Mrs Caroline!! Buffet lunch, home cooking. Doesn't get much better than this!

data.title: Down home southern cookin.
data.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. The nicest staff the best food it's always packed. Hours are a little weird but that adds character in my opinion. This place is truly a hidden gem that tourists don't know about. Great value.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: They serve chocolate gravy for breakfast! That is a plus for me! Lunch buffet is awesome! There is a lot of food choices and great desserts!

data.title: Delicious homestyle buffet!
data.text: This is my favorite place for Sunday lunch! The chicken & dressing, roast beef and all the vegetables remind me of mom's home cooking. The desserts are yummy too!

data.title: Good down home food!
data.text: Buffet style great food! They keep expanding but it still seems kind of tight. Price includes salad bar and drink plus dessert. All food tasted great. I had some enchilada, cabbage green beans and cucumbers plus strawberry cake. Parking a little tough also

data.title: Wow
data.text: This place was absolutely awesome, I would be eat here every week if I lived in Jonesboro.  The food was great and the desert was unbelievable.  It's like a Ryan's but with really good food.

data.title: Excellent homemade food buffet for hungry country-folks.
data.text:
I love homemade food.. esp. when it's like something Mom would make.   If you're in Jonesboro and you just want some good, down-to-earth, delicious homemade food, this is the place.  Every item is flavorful and nothing is out of a can.  Rolls, entrees, sides, desserts.. etc.. all piping hot and tasty.  I destroyed two plates.. and I normally eat one.

Place is busy (packed) during lunch hours, so if you can come earlier or later.. all the better.   Price is right and the staff very friendly.  You know you got the right place where everyone is smiling and happy.  I was one of 'em. 

Also.. you may see the name: Chef's INN.. but it's actually Chef's In.. as "The Chef is in" buffet.  I don't know who added the extra N.. but don't let this confuse you if you're looking for the place.

data.title: Would give more stars, but they're "fudging" on the meat
data.text: This is the best place in Jonesboro for home cooking.  Home-made rolls, jalapeno cornbread, special desserts of the day on dessert bar, good salad bar, large selection of daily entrees & sides.  Best service in town.  $10 includes drink.  The downside:  lots of people in the south crave real home cooked chicken & dressing.  Theirs is the best I've had.  BUT....they've stopped putting ANY chicken at all in it....YET still call it "chicken & dressing" as a featured entree for Sunday & Wednesday.  When it got down to literally just a few extremely thin hairlike "threads" of chicken to be found in the dressing, I voiced a complaint.  I was told they put 60 lbs of chicken in their dressing.  This was simply not true when it was down to threads of the meat and last Sunday, I found not even a thread of chicken.  AND the usually good dressing was watered down and was under baked.  They even have the good "giblet gravy" that always sets off a good cornbread dressing....but it's always minus the giblets.  All of their other chicken entrees featured on other days are chock full of chicken:  their chicken & dumplings are the best, there's a Mexican chicken dish full of chicken, fried chicken, baked chicken.....  Chef's Inn.....PLEEEZZZZ get the chicken back in your "chicken & dressing" entree or call it a side dish.  PORK CHOP DAY quit being pork chops long ago.  I was told way back then that they fry up 200 chops and substitute w/pork steak when those run out.  But for some time now, it's been strictly pork steak....NO CHOPS EVER.  While that's fine with me (I like the pork steak better), it's not okay with others.  I have relatives who will not go with me now on "Pork Chop Day".  And of course, full disclosure, the daily line-up on the paper menu to take home needs to be updated.  CALL IT WHAT IT IS.  SIMPLE.  But I'd rather you start putting chicken back in that dressing......  PLEASE?

data.title: Your must Sunday go-to crowd pleaser
data.text: Craving a little down-home comfort? Satisfy your soul with these delicious and wholesome Southern favorites at Chef's In!

data.title: Great meals
data.text: Chef's in is always packed because it is great.  They have a lunch buffet to die for.  Chicken and dumplings, meat loaf, etc.  It is real home cooking and you will love it.

data.title: Poor Buffet
data.text: The food on the buffet looked like it had been sitting there for 2 days, and the price was very high. Will not visit again.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: I usually eat at chefs inn on Wednesday. That's my favorite day because of the dressing.this time it was a Thursday and I just was not impressed.

data.title: Great comfort food if you like that kind1
data.text: Country cooking just like your southern grandma made every Sunday, greasy and sweet. Tastes great but you are not going to find much that falls in the healthy category here. Even a salad, which is iceburg lettuce, tomato, and carrots. It is family owned and most of it is made there. I do suspect that the "some" of the desserts are bought frozen. If you are visiting, you have to try the apple frittars!

data.title: Comfort at its best
data.text: If you are craving home comfort food...this is your place!  Family owned and operated, you can check on the specials each week or just come on by. You have lots of ootions so come get your comfort food on.

data.title: Here is the local hole in the wall thats outstanding!!
data.text: All of us locals eat here--great variety--specialties are different each day but there are no bad days! Buffet w lots of veggies liked cooked cabbage, lima beans etc. desserts are regular and sugar free. Good friendly service and all great home cooked plate food!

data.title: Customer appreciation day
data.text: We love Chefs Inn. Customer appreciation day usually falls on Wednesday when it comes around which is awesome because that's chicken and dressing day. Mom and pop place with home cooking. Well worth your time to visit.

data.title: Good country food
data.text: All food is homemade, good variety and very good food.  Dessert bar is good and plenty of selection.  Great service and would highly recommend if you like great country cooking!  Only negative during peek lunch times they get very busy.
